profile.name: MYKOLA CHUDAK
profile.education: [{'institution': 'University of Manitoba', 'degree': "Bachelor's, Computer Science", 'year': '2023'}, {'institution': 'Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv', 'degree': "Bachelor's, Economics", 'year': '2023'}]

experiences.job_description: Led a data migration team of 2–4 members across multiple end-to-end D365 Finance & Operations implementations for mid-size enterprises. Designed, built, and optimized ELT pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Databricks and Logic Apps to process and transform large-scale data.

Developed scalable ELT pipelines and PySpark transformation scripts to automate data migration workflows from Azure Data Lake to D365. Integrated Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Logic Apps to streamline ingestion, transformation, and loading processes.
Managed delivery lifecycle via Azure DevOps.

Completed multiple machine learning projects using Python (NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib), focusing on both supervised and end-to-end ML pipelines including preprocessing, model training (Linear/Logistic Regression, KNN, SVM), and deployment.
Developed unsupervised learning techniques using RESTful APIs via MVC architecture. Reproducibility for future experiments.
Managed delivery lifecycle via Azure DevOps.

Drafted Functional Design Documents for custom features, ensuring alignment with user requirements and development feasibility. UofM Hackathon – placed 1st in the 'most impactful' and 'best project overall' categories. I was responsible for DB data modeling, implementing AWS cloud infrastructure, scraping & preparing data, orchestrating workflows using AWS Lambda and preparing visualizations.
